title: How to make proper use of the unlimited Internet I have - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘Lot of internet’ is a big treasure for almost anyone today. Here is a list of websites that you can try: Funny Memes - 9gag, 9gag TV, 4chanLearning languages in a graphical interface - DuolingoLearning anything (yes, thousands of topics) in a graphical interface - MemriseDocumentaries - topdocumentaryfilms, documentaryheavenSports sites - for streaming sports events, highlightsMovies - NetFlixSongs - Spotify, Last.fm, SoundCloudShopping - Amazon

Download live linux cd images. Install them in a virtual server and experiment with them. There is so much to learn. Search youtube for DIY (do it yourself) projects. See the videos and learn how to build things. If you can go further (and are a bit daunting and you have a good knowledge about computers and if you can follow everything that is written word to word) and if you have a high end smartphone then you can follow tutorials to root it and install custom Roms. The above will increase your thirst for knowledge and improve it a lot. As usual you can download stuff like movies via torrents too which is most users with unlimited internet bandwidth do. Ravi.

With a 1000/1000 Mbit/s fiber connection without a data cap I basically already have that. I don't do anything that I have not done previous at 500/500 or 200/200 or 8/2 all in Mbit/s. The only difference is that I don't download anything anymore, it is no point, I can download stuff faster then I can consume the information. So basically I am the limitation in data consumption. The only other difference would be to do some sort of sever setup and by so marketing my Internet connection, but that is boring so I would not do it. So in reality you are likely having a limitation in your contract with your ISP of selling bandwidth, that mean that you are limited to consumption. Use it and enjoy it, keep on towards happiness…

There is many things to do with Unlimited Interbet like you can Watch Online TV Series , Subscribe some Channels as per your area of interest in YouTube, you can use reddit and Quora and learn something and discuss on it…

Stream and Surf like you have never done before. LOL. Well, as far the usability is concerned, there are way more opportunities for you to avail than watching TV or Netflixing only. Like, you can either signup for online tutorials and learn programming or Quantum Physics, anything productive that can add value to your resume as well as career development.

Use it. Download movies, games, songs, etc. Here are some of my favorite games which you can download - Asphalt 8 airborneNova 3 freedom editionColor switchCrissy roadPokemon goThese are some of the games I like and can be downloaded through both play and app store

You can stream HD content. But if you don’t watch movies, tv shows or even YouTube videos online then you can download PC games and play online but if you’re not in gaming as well then you can stream HQ music. If you’re not interested in any of these then you can try helping your friends, family, neighbours if they want anything from internet.

How about watching tons of movie online with your data? Or maybe open hotspot and download lots of multiple gigabyte game on steam? You could even download the whole internet if you want, but I don't think your hard drive can support that….
Provide free WIFI for who don't have an internet connection.

Internet is Source of Information. Unlimited Internet = Biggest size Hard disk. I will use internet as my Hard disk Drive. Unlimited Video Calling (May Be All Calls) Unlimited Ebooks. Unlimited Softwares. A Biggest Network of People. It's like to Become a Superhero.

If you want to earn money, open an Internet Cafe or something.If you want some Entertainment, download some TV shows in good quality like:FriendsThe FlashGame of ThronesThe Big Bang TheorySuitsLegends of TomorrowBlack Mirroretc.
Hehe… give it to the CM of Delhi… he has promised Free WiFi..)))
Learn Some different things that can help in future like Photography, Video Editing, About Affiliate Marketing, About YouTube, About Blogging, etc
